EXCEPTION.Definition: something that is is not included in a rule, group, or list

TAKE THIS FOR GRANTED.Definition: to not properly appreciate something because it has always been there

SMALLPOX.Definition: an extremely infectious disease that causes a fever, spots on the skin, and often death

MUMPS.Definition: an infectious disease that causes painful swelling in the neck and slight fever

POLIO.Definition: a serious disease that can paralyse your arms and legs

TETANUS.Definition: a serious disease caused by bacteria entering the body

GERM.Definition: a small organism that causes disease

INJECTIONS.Definition: the act of putting something into someone's body using a small needle

SWALLOW.Definition: to make something go down your throat and towards your stomach

IMMUNE SYSTEM.Definition: your body's system that makes it able to protect itself

VIRUS.Definition: a very small piece of material that causes disease

BACTERIA.Definition: very small living things that cause disease

ANTIBODIES.Definition: proteins produced in the blood that fight disease

IMMUNITY.Definition: the state of being protected against a disease

CONTAGIOUS.Definition: a contagious disease is easy to catch from other people

SCABS.Definition: a rough surface made of dried bloody

VOMITING.Definition: emptying your stomach through your mouth

VARIOLATION.Definition: a primitive way of protecting against smallpox

RUBBING.Definition: pressing something against a surface and moving it

ARISTOCRATIC.Definition: relating to the highest class in society

SCARS.Definition: marks left on the body after an injury has healed

ROADBLOCK.Definition: something that stops the progress of a plan

IMMUNISING.Definition: protecting a person by putting a small substance into their body

SYMPTOMS.Definition: feelings or changes typical of a disease

IMMUNOLOGY.Definition: the scientific study of disease prevention

IMMUNISATION.Definition: the process of being made immune

PHILANTHROPIC.Definition: relating to helping the poorest in society

MISSIONS.Definition: important jobs, especially that involve going to another place

MEDAL.Definition: a small metal disc, given as a reward

SPIRALLING OUT OF CONTROL.Definition: becoming less and less easy to control

BODY.Definition: a group of people within an organisation

RABIES.Definition: a serious disease of the nervous system

ANTHRAX.Definition: a disease that causes fever and death

OPPOSED.Definition: if you are opposed to something, you disagree with it

HERD IMMUNITY.Definition: the state of enough people in a group being immune to a disease, so that others are protected

MEASLES.Definition: a disease that produces small, red spots

RUBELLA.Definition: a contagious disease often called German measles

AUTISM.Definition: a mental disorder making it hard to communicate properly

THE MEDICAL REGISTER.Definition: the list of people who are allowed to practise medicine

FRAUD.Definition: if something is a fraud, it is not what it claims to be

FIGUREHEAD.Definition: someone who seems to be the leader of a movement or country, but has no real power

SCRATCHING THEIR HEADS.Definition: not sure about what to do

CONDITIONED.Definition: if you are conditioned to do something, you have been taught to do it

TROLL FARM.Definition: an organisation employing people to make deliberately offensive or provocative online posts in order to cause conflict or manipulate public opinion.

ELEPHANT IN THE ROOM.Definition: an important subject that is not talked about
